summary: The year 1977 is significant in the context of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll certifications for the HSCA during the months of September, October, and December of 1977. These certifications detail the names, positions, and salaries of the committee staff during those periods. The documents collectively provide a snapshot of the HSCA's operational expenses and staffing during a specific period of its investigation into the JFK assassination.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations
significance: The year 1977 marks a period during which the HSCA was actively investigating the JFK assassination. The payroll certifications offer insight into the committee's staffing and financial resources dedicated to the investigation during that time. While the documents themselves do not directly reveal specific findings or investigative activities, they provide a tangible record of the HSCA's operations and resource allocation.
